pros: Good benefit options and time off
cons: People get overworked and no one cares
Need better communication, between upper management and lower staff

pros: Always able to get extra hours; evening shift (PMs) are laid back (more of a team effort). When on call, there is a great chance that you will be called in. The benefit of having a hugely discounted membership at Condell Centre Club. Free parking.
cons: Department supervisor lacks communication skills. Overwhelming evidence of sexist environment. Due to excessive favortism, most job related problems are not met with rational resolutions (ie. depending on how the supervisor feels about you, they may or may not encourage the perpetrator to antagonize the situation). The supervisor creates most of the day to day drama in the radiology department. There is always retaliation against workers that the supervisor don't favor at the hands of their "pets" (ie. there's alot of framing going on). Career advancement not encouraged, if you are interested in another modality, the radiology supervisor makes every job related issue difficult for you. Absolutely no positive reinforcement; and feedback was always related to a complaint. The supervisor disrepects some employees in the presence of other employees calling some of them "not bright", incompetent, and idiots.

review_title: Every unit is different and it takes a long time to find a unit that you are able connect with
pros: My individual unit is very supportive towards personal needs and most coworkers are accomidating and helpful even during busy days.
cons: The scheduling is unorganized and holiday coverage is somewhat unfair.  Hostile coworkers are rarely dealt with.  Management is wonderful personally, but disorganized professionally.

review_title: No teamwork, everyone only looked out for themselves.
pros: Pay was not terrible.  Different shift lengths provided for more days off.  Vacation accrual was good.  The emergency department worked well as a team and for the most part treated everyone fairly.
cons: In my department, there were no breaks.  Anyone would throw you under the bus or make things up to try and make themselves look better.  People really treated support staff like garbage.
